item.title: AI Coding Tools
item.description:
What is vibe coding? AI-assisted development for rapid prototyping and iteration. Trade-offs: speed vs. maintainability.

Tools: Cursor (AI IDE, Composer, agent mode, .cursor/rules). Claude Code (CLI, /init, /clear, CLAUDE.md, thinking modes). GitHub Copilot (autocomplete, chat). Others: Windsurf, Aider, Cline. Comparing features and choosing the right tool.

item.title: Workflow Patterns
item.description: Explore → Plan → Code → Commit workflow. Project structure and file organization for AI context. Permission modes for different tasks. Using /clear between unrelated tasks. Parallel subagents for frontend/backend. Breaking large features into subtasks.

item.title: Code Review & QA
item.description: Treating AI output like a teammate’s PR. Inspecting diffs, running tests, verifying logic. Unit tests, integration tests, CI/CD. Using AI to write tests. Multiple agents for write/review separation. Never blindly accepting changes.

item.title: Common Pitfalls
item.description: Over-reliance on AI without review. Prompt drift (AI changing things you didn’t ask for). Dependency bloat. Skipping tests. Accepting fixes that mask root causes. Context pollution from stale conversations. Security risks from unreviewed code.
